title: Temporary Graduate (Replacement stream) visa (subclass 485)
summary: This page provides information for people who already hold, or who applied before 1 July 2024 for, the Temporary Graduate (Replacement stream) visa (subclass 485). The visa is closed to new primary applicants. The page explains current visa holder rights, obligations, family member rules, and reporting requirements.

who_this_information_is_for: People already granted a Temporary Graduate (Replacement stream) visa (subclass 485)
People who applied on or before 30 June 2024 and whose application is still undecided

visa_validity.validity_information: If you already hold the visa, it remains valid until the expiry date granted.

activities_allowed: Have eligible dependant family members apply to join you in Australia

requirements: Comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws
Maintain adequate health insurance while in Australia
Continue to meet the requirements of the visa stream under which the visa was granted
Leave Australia when the visa ends unless granted another visa

family_members.subsequent_entrant_rules: Dependant family members who did not apply initially may apply as subsequent entrants from inside or outside Australia while the primary visa remains valid.
family_members.when_visa_ends: Family members must leave Australia when the primary visa holder's visa ends.
family_obligations: Intend to remain members of the family unit
Maintain adequate health insurance while in Australia
family_members.additional_conditions_notice: The department will advise if there are any other conditions family members must comply with upon visa grant.

reporting_changes.instruction: Visa holders must report changes in circumstances.

tools_and_resources.vevo: Visa holders can use Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) for free to check visa details and entitlements.
